section.name: Workflow configuration
section.span: Workflows are configured by specifying how the workflow can be accessed and how the workflow is applicable. This definition is stored in the repository itself.
section.p: All available workflows are stored in the JCR repository in the tree /hippo:configuration/hippo:workflows. Workflow definitions are not directly stored at this level, instead workflows are categorized. At the structure /hippo:configuration/hippo:workflows the workflow categories are listed.

Within each category, a list of possible workflow definitions is present in an orderable list. For example the specification for a workflow named myworkflow which is applicable for category mycategory is stored in the JCR repository at the node starting with path /hippo:configuration/hippo:workflows/mycategory/myworkflow.

ul.li: A small description of the workflow;
The node type for which JCR nodes this workflow is applicable;
The classname of the class that implements the workflow in the repository;
The classname of the class used to render the workflow access in front-end applications;

section.p: These are specified as properties and child nodes of the workflow node. In general the above settings are shipped with a workflow implementation. This means that you should just add the definition shipped with a workflow at the location
Only a single category, with the name workflowPlugin is in use by the supplied Hippo CMS application.

If the workflow settings information is delivered by the addon in the file workflow-config.xml you can use the following snippet in your configuration.xml to let the bootstrap procedure load the new workflow defined in workflow-config.xml.
